prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 4 units by 6 units. 1. **Create Coordinate System** Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler Angles to 0.0, 0.0, -90.0 degrees. Set the Translation Vector to 0.0, 0.75, 0.0. 2. **Draw Sketch on Face 1** Draw a sketch on Face 1 of the coordinate system. 2.1. **Draw Loop 1** Draw Loop 1 on the sketch. 2.1.1. **Draw Line 1** Draw Line 1 in Loop 1. Start the line at 0.0, 0.125 and end it at 0.0722, 0.0. 2.1.2. **Draw Line 2** Draw Line 2 in Loop 1. Start the line at 0.0722, 0.0 and end it at 0.2165, 0.0. 2.1.3. **Draw Line 3** Draw Line 3 in Loop 1. Start the line at 0.2165, 0.0 and end it at 0.2887, 0.125. 2.1.4. **Draw Line 4** Draw Line 4 in Loop 1. Start the line at 0.2887, 0.125 and end it at 0.2165, 0.25. 2.1.5. **Draw Line 5** Draw Line 5 in Loop 1. Start the line at 0.2165, 0.25 and end it at 0.0722, 0.25. 2.1.6. **Draw Line 6** Draw Line 6 in Loop 1. Start the line at 0.0722, 0.25 and end it at 0.0, 0.125. 3. **Extrude Sketch** Extrude the sketch along the normal direction by 0.75 units. Conduct no extrusion in the opposite direction. Employ a scaling factor of 0.2887. Label the operation as "Create a new body". The length, width, and height of the prism are 0.2887, 0.75, and 0.2887 respectively.</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.75,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.125],"End Point":[0.0722,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.0722,0.0],"End Point":[0.2165,0.0]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.2165,0.0],"End Point":[0.2887,0.125]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.2887,0.125],"End Point":[0.2165,0.25]},"line_5":{"Start Point":[0.2165,0.25],"End Point":[0.0722,0.25]},"line_6":{"Start Point":[0.0722,0.25],"End Point":[0.0,0.125]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.75,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.2887,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

Step 5: Transform 2D sketch into 3D sketch Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch rotating it according to the euler angles (-90.0, 0.0, -90.0) and translate it by the translation vector of the coordinate system. Step 6: Extrude the 2D sketch to 3D Extrude the 2D sketch to create a 3D solid body with an extrude depth of 0.537 towards the normal direction, an extrude depth of 0.0 in the opposite direction, and scale the sketch by 0.3774 during the extrusion. prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism with a Curved Side Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side. The prism is positioned diagonally from the bottom left to the top right corner of the image. The cylindrical hole is centered along the diagonal axis of the prism. The prism has a flat bottom and a flat top. The height of the prism is approximately twice the width, and the width is approximately half the height. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to (0.0, 0.0, -90.0) degrees and the Translation Vector to (0.0, 0.75, 0.0). This places the coordinate system at the lower-right corner of the prism.
